content: Set goals for yourself. Studies suggest that having goals (and people who support those goals) may help you be less likely to use drugs. [1] This is likely because it encourages you to consider what you want out of your future and what you'll do to get yourself there. In contrast, using drugs is all about what feels "good" right now, regardless of the impact it makes on your future. [2] If you feel tempted to try drugs, even once, consider what it may do to your goals for the future. How likely are you to be able to achieve your goals if you're dependent on an expensive and/or illegal drug, or in jail or with a criminal record for using it? Setting goals can also help improve your self-confidence. [3] When you feel confident in yourself and your ability to achieve what you set out to do, you're less likely to want to do drugs. [4] Setting and achieving goals is also crucial to getting off of drugs. This practice shows you that you can achieve what you set out to do, including kick your drug use. [5] Spend time with your loved ones. Strong relationships with your family and loved ones are a protective factor against drug use. In other words, having a strong relationship with your family and friends will make you less likely to give in to temptation. [6] If you’re feeling pressured or curious about drug use, don’t keep it to yourself. Find someone you know, trust, and respect to talk to about it. Other people can offer you advice and support, which is very important for staying drug free. [7] Talk to someone about what’s going on. If you’re consistently being pressured, even bullied, to try drugs, talk to someone in authority, such as a parent, teacher, or counselor. [8] You don’t have to face this pressure on your own. Getting support from others will help you stand strong against drugs. Do something else to feel good. If you are tempted to use drugs because you want to feel good, keep your focus off of drugs by doing other things that are enjoyable and fun. [9] For example, take up a hobby, spend more time laughing with friends, play a fun video game, or help others out, to feel better instead. This will help you find new meaning in your life [10] . Go for a run, get lost in a good novel, talk to family and friends, play a fun video game, or actively try to solve your problem or negative thoughts by seeking counselling. [11] Talk about how you feel with friends or engage in a distracting activity like going out to a movie. Stop before you start. If you're offered drugs, decline and walk away. If you're afraid of peer pressure, then know in your heart that true friends will respect you if you decide to say no to a drug, and they won't push you into doing something you don't want to do. If they do, then consider finding a new group of friends. Keep your distance. If you see a family member or friend taking drugs, stay away from them and definitely don't follow in their footsteps. If you can, talk to a trusted adult friend about it; they may offer guidance or social support. A support system can be crucial to a person's success in achieving and maintaining a drug–free lifestyle. [12] Be aware that vulnerability to drug addiction can run in the family, so if you have a family member who is addicted to drugs, know that you may be especially vulnerable and should do that much more to be drug free. [13] If you have friends who actively use drugs, find new friends. Instead, surround yourself with people who do not use drugs and who think being sober is a better way to live. [14] Teens are especially likely to use drugs if their friends do. [15] Avoid temptation. If there is a certain group of people at school who are known to do drugs, don't hang around them. You can find friends who are interested in more productive behaviors. If you are at a party and you realize that there are drugs there, simply leave. Peer pressure might make you crack, even if you're certain you'll be able to say no. Be aware that social influence is very strong, and it has an effect on your temptation to use drugs. [16] Even social media can influence you to be more likely to use drugs. [17] If you notice a lot of photos about drug use on your social media, consider blocking those sources of influence too. Reflect on your temptations. If you're tempted to try drugs even when you're on your own, such as seeing what it would be like to experiment with your kid brother's Adderall, you can handle that temptation too. Think to yourself, "Why am I really wanting to try this?" What are your reasons for wanting to try drugs? [18] If it's because you think everyone else is doing it and you want to connect with your buddies, remind yourself that not everyone is doing drugs. In fact, drug use in general is down among young people. [19] There are plenty of great, healthy ways to connect with your friends, such as taking up a hobby or sport together. If it's because you're feeling stressed or pressured, recognize that drug use is a common way to handle stress, but it's very unhealthy. There are great ways to handle stress, such as exercise, yoga, and meditation. If you feel really stressed out, talking to a therapist could help too. Remember that your decision-making skills haven’t fully matured if you’re a teen. [20] Choosing to use drugs is a decision that could haunt you for the rest of your life. Will your 50-year-old self thank you for deciding to try drugs? Say no assertively. Most likely there will come a time when you will be asked to do drugs. Be firm in your answer and do not hesitate. If you hesitate you leave the door open for peer pressure. If someone who offers you drugs asks you why you do not want to do them you do not need to give any reasons. Just say that you don’t do drugs. If you provide reasons you leave the door open for further conversation, where the person can then try to persuade you to try the drugs. [21] You may have people try to change your mind by saying things such as "But everyone's doing it" or "Just once won't hurt you." Remain firm. You can tell the person that in fact, drug use has gone down among young people, so clearly not everyone is doing it, and you won't be either. [22] Or you can say "Nope, not even once. I don't need that in my life." Stay engaged. Keep your mind sharp and actively involved in the world around you. If you stay engaged and busy and active you will not have the time to do drugs. Boredom can lead to drug use, so by never being bored you will be less likely to use drugs. [23] Learn a new language. Pick up a hobby. Teach yourself a musical instrument. Volunteer in your community. You will enrich your life (and boost your resume) and help yourself stay away from drugs. Figure out what makes you happy. Depression and low self-esteem can lead to drug use. If you are experiencing depression , you should seek a counselor to help you work through it. In addition, pursuing things that make you happy and maintain your self-esteem will make you less likely to default to drug use. [24] Make a list of everything that makes you happy. Pick a few that are easily attainable, such as experiences like cooking an inexpensive meal, or going to the movies, and be sure to engage in those activities regularly. Understand why people use drugs. People become addicted because they are self-medicating. Then they are held within the cycle of addiction because of the withdrawal symptoms from the drug.The way to become drug free is to first confront the physical addiction through going to a clinic where you can participate in a program to help with the withdrawal symptoms, which at times can be life-threatening, and then addressing the emotional issues that lead to the decision to use addicting drugs to mask the emotional pain. [25] People who use drugs are not “bad” or “immoral” people. People who use drugs often cannot simply “knock it off.” Drug addictions change your brain in ways that make it difficult -- but not impossible -- to quit. Know your triggers. If you have used drugs before, be cognizant of the triggers that are associated with your using drugs. This could include drug paraphernalia, a group of friends, a certain location, or even a certain song that you used to listen to when you did drugs. [26] If there are certain triggers that you know may cause a problem and lead to drug use, throw them away. Delete that song from your ipod or throw out those rolling papers; if your triggers are permanently gone you will be less likely to use drugs. You may also need to not go to places you used to go when you used drugs. Staying away may be difficult, but it will help you kick your drug use. Join a community or family-based recovery support system. Support is key not only to staying off of drugs, but to getting off them. If you are struggling to live a drug free life, a support group may be helpful. To find one, talk to your doctor, counselor or other healthcare provider, check your phone book for a list of local support groups, consult with your religious or secular community groups, or speak with local or national groups who are devoted to helping people get past addictions [27] . Try “urge surfing. ” Urge surfing is a mindfulness exercise that acknowledges your craving and helps you “ride it out” until it goes away. Imagine you are a surfer riding your craving like a wave until it breaks and becomes soft and small and easy to handle. [28] Urge surfing is more effective than trying to ignore or repress a craving. [29] Remind yourself that this probably is not the first time you have experienced the urge to do drugs. Has that urge passed before? The answer is almost certainly yes. Remind yourself that it will pass this time too. The urge exists, but you do not have to act on it. [30] Notice the thoughts and sensations that you experience during the urge. For example, you might feel a strong feeling that you want to use your drug of choice. You might feel sweaty or itchy, or feel restless. Acknowledge these as existing. Remind yourself that they are just thoughts; they do not truly have power over you. [31] Focus on deep breathing as you surf your urges. Breathe slowly and evenly, in and out. This will help keep your attention on the present moment rather than focusing on your craving. Tell yourself you’ll wait 10 minutes. If you feel a very strong urge to use drugs, delay by telling yourself you will make yourself wait 10 minutes. Just 10, that’s all. You can do that. When that 10 minutes is up, if the urge is still strong, tell yourself you’ll wait another 10 minutes. Keep delaying until the urge passes. It will, given enough time. [32] Eat healthy. The mind and body are intricately related because the mind consists of the complex workings of the brain, a biological organ and part of the body. This means that mental health and bodily health are closely related. Since poor mental health is associated with drug use, and mental and bodily health are related, keeping a healthy body is an important part of being drug free. One way to maintain a healthy body is to eat healthy foods. [33] Eat whole foods such as lean meats, nuts, fruits, and vegetables. Who knows, you might even develop a passion for cooking that builds your self-esteem and turns into a hobby that helps to keep you drug free. [34] Exercise. Working out can release endorphins that make you feel good in a much healthier way than the way that drugs make you feel good. Exercise helps to reduce stress and can even combat minor cases of depression; both stress and depression increase risk for drug use, so it is important to exercise regularly to help to keep drug free. [35] Avoid having too much caffeine. Too much caffeine can make you jittery and anxious which can contribute to feelings of stress and make you more likely to turn to using (other) drugs to counteract the anxiety that the caffeine produced. [36] [37] Get enough sleep. A lack of sleep can contribute to poor mental health such as by causing feelings of fatigue, sadness, and anxiety, all of which may add to your likelihood of using drugs in order to avoid feeling bad. [38] Relax your body and mind. Practice relaxation techniques to help stay mentally and physically healthy. Relaxation techniques reduce the impact of stress on your body by negating negative feelings and negative bodily sensations such as muscle tension. [39] Stress is a common reason that people begin using drugs, so managing your stress will help you stay drug-free. [40] Try visualization. This technique involves forming peaceful and relaxing mental images. For example, picture a calm ocean and try to imagine it with all of your senses; think about how it would smell, how the wind and sun would feel against your skin. Fully immerse yourself in the experience. [41] Try a soothing exercise, such as yoga or tai chi. Try meditation. Meditation can be an excellent way to manage stress and focus on breathing and body awareness. Meditate to calm yourself as you confront urges to use alcohol or drugs. [42] People who meditate tend to have greater success rates of staying off drugs in the long run. [43] Find a comfortable and quiet spot to sit for 10-15 minutes. Focus on your breath, inhaling deeply and steadily. As thoughts pass through your mind, release them without judgment. Turn your attention back to your breath. Try progressive muscle relaxation. This technique helps you to figure out the difference between tense and relaxed muscles. It involves slowly tensing then relaxing each muscle group; this will help to delineate the difference between tense and relaxed and take your mind off what is stressing you out. [44] Begin with your toes. Clench them as hard as you can for 5 seconds, and then relax for 5 seconds. Notice the sensation of relaxation. Move up your body from your calves, thighs, buttocks, abs, chest, shoulders, arms, neck, and face. [45] Seek counseling. People who are recovering from an addiction need guidance and treatment. Counseling can offer you the support you need to remain drug free when giving up or recovering from an addiction. [46] Behavioral treatment, such as cognitive behavioral therapy, is very effective in helping people who use drugs manage their urges and stop their drug use. Family therapy can also be helpful, particularly if your family dysfunction is contributing to your drug use. Contingency management uses positive reinforcement, such as rewards, for staying off drugs. Consider attending a detox facility. There are benefits and drawbacks to inpatient or outpatient facilities. Inpatient facilities enable close monitoring, remove the potential for drug use, and the detox process is fairly accelerated. However, these can be quite expensive and may limit other activities, such as work. Outpatient treatments cost less and have less of an impact on the individual's life, but may not be as effective due to the potential for access to drugs due to being outside of the facility.This has the advantage of being less disruptive to the patient's life and less expensive. The best setting depends on a variety of factors, including the drug of abuse, the drug user's amount and length of history of abuse, the patient's age, and co-existing medical and/or psychiatric conditions among others. [47] To find a detox center, search here: / People with serious drug use problems, a long history of drug use, involvement in criminal activity, or trouble with social functioning due to drugs are often helped by residential treatment at a detox facility. [48] Find a sponsor. Many peer-based support groups assign sponsors to new members. The sponsor is a recovering addict who will help you through the steps of the recovery program. A good sponsor will [49] : help you to grow, to become more productive, by your definition. help you become more autonomous, more loving of yourself, more excited, less sensitive, more free to become the authority for your own living. not be a crutch or be around you if you fail to make progress.

<p>You don’t have to look hard to find someone whose life has been damaged by his use of drugs. Many people have made the decision to use drugs, and regretted it, but that doesn't have to be you. For those that are already addicted: you can be drug free.</p>

<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Handling_the_Temptation_to_Try_Drugs">Handling the Temptation to Try Drugs</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-1-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-1-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/04/Be-Drug-Free-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_e44436fb13" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e44436fb13')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/04/Be-Drug-Free-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Set <a href="/Write-Personal-Goals" title="Write Personal Goals">goals</a> for yourself.</b> Studies suggest that having goals (and people who support those goals) may help you be less likely to use drugs.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup> This is likely because it encourages you to consider what you want out of your future and what you'll do to get yourself there. In contrast, using drugs is all about what feels "good" right now, regardless of the impact it makes on your future.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you feel tempted to try drugs, even once, consider what it may do to your goals for the future. How likely are you to be able to achieve your goals if you're dependent on an expensive and/or illegal drug, or in jail or with a criminal record for using it?</li>
<li>Setting goals can also help improve your self-confidence.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup> When you feel confident in yourself and your ability to achieve what you set out to do, you're less likely to want to do drugs.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Setting and achieving goals is also crucial to getting off of drugs. This practice shows you that you can achieve what you set out to do, including kick your drug use.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-2-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-2-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Be-Drug-Free-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-2-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_5ee5abf180" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5ee5abf180')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Be-Drug-Free-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-2-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Spend time with your loved ones.</b> Strong relationships with your family and loved ones are a protective factor against drug use. In other words, having a strong relationship with your family and friends will make you less likely to give in to temptation.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you’re feeling pressured or curious about drug use, don’t keep it to yourself. Find someone you know, trust, and respect to talk to about it. Other people can offer you advice and support, which is very important for staying drug free.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-3-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-3-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8a/Be-Drug-Free-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-3-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_3a8a58b91b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3a8a58b91b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8a/Be-Drug-Free-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-3-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Talk to someone about what’s going on.</b> If you’re consistently being pressured, even bullied, to try drugs, talk to someone in authority, such as a parent, teacher, or counselor.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup> You don’t have to face this pressure on your own. Getting support from others will help you stand strong against drugs.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-4-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-4-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d8/Be-Drug-Free-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-4-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_4a67beee10" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4a67beee10')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d8/Be-Drug-Free-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-4-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Do something else to feel good.</b> If you are tempted to use drugs because you want to feel good, keep your focus off of drugs by doing other things that are enjoyable and fun.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>For example, take up a hobby, spend more time laughing with friends, play a fun video game, or help others out, to feel better instead. This will help you find new meaning in your life<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>.</li>
<li>Go for a run, get lost in a good novel, talk to family and friends, play a fun video game, or actively try to solve your problem or negative thoughts by seeking counselling.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Talk about how you feel with friends or engage in a distracting activity like going out to a movie.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-5-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-5-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/Be-Drug-Free-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_ebf48d6108" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ebf48d6108')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/Be-Drug-Free-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><b>Stop before you start.</b></b> If you're offered drugs, decline and walk away. If you're afraid of peer pressure, then know in your heart that true friends will respect you if you decide to say no to a drug, and they won't push you into doing something you don't want to do. If they do, then consider finding a new group of friends.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-6-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-6-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Be-Drug-Free-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-6-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_74fb44822f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_74fb44822f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Be-Drug-Free-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-6-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Keep your distance.</b> If you see a family member or friend taking drugs, stay away from them and definitely don't follow in their footsteps. If you can, talk to a trusted adult friend about it; they may offer guidance or social support. A support system can be crucial to a person's success in achieving and maintaining a drug–free lifestyle.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Be aware that vulnerability to drug addiction can run in the family, so if you have a family member who is addicted to drugs, know that you may be especially vulnerable and should do that much more to be drug free.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>If you have friends who actively use drugs, find new friends. Instead, surround yourself with people who do not use drugs and who think being sober is a better way to live.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 14" class="reference" id="_ref-14"><a href="#_note-14">[14]</a></sup> Teens are especially likely to use drugs if their friends do.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 15" class="reference" id="_ref-15"><a href="#_note-15">[15]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-7-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-7-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Be-Drug-Free-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-7-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_fcdae32438" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fcdae32438')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Be-Drug-Free-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-7-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><b>Avoid temptation.</b></b> If there is a certain group of people at school who are known to do drugs, don't hang around them. You can find friends who are interested in more productive behaviors.

<ul>
<li>If you are at a party and you realize that there are drugs there, simply leave. Peer pressure might make you crack, even if you're certain you'll be able to say no.</li>
<li>Be aware that social influence is very strong, and it has an effect on your temptation to use drugs.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 16" class="reference" id="_ref-16"><a href="#_note-16">[16]</a></sup> Even social media can influence you to be more likely to use drugs.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 17" class="reference" id="_ref-17"><a href="#_note-17">[17]</a></sup> If you notice a lot of photos about drug use on your social media, consider blocking those sources of influence too.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-8-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-8-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Be-Drug-Free-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_4fdaf498cc" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4fdaf498cc')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Be-Drug-Free-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Reflect on your temptations.</b> If you're tempted to try drugs even when you're on your own, such as seeing what it would be like to experiment with your kid brother's Adderall, you can handle that temptation too. Think to yourself, "Why am I really wanting to try this?" What are your reasons for wanting to try drugs?<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 18" class="reference" id="_ref-18"><a href="#_note-18">[18]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If it's because you think everyone else is doing it and you want to connect with your buddies, remind yourself that <i>not</i> everyone is doing drugs. In fact, drug use in general is down among young people.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 19" class="reference" id="_ref-19"><a href="#_note-19">[19]</a></sup> There are plenty of great, healthy ways to connect with your friends, such as taking up a hobby or sport together.</li>
<li>If it's because you're feeling stressed or pressured, recognize that drug use is a common way to handle stress, but it's very unhealthy. There are great ways to handle stress, such as exercise, yoga, and meditation. If you feel really stressed out, talking to a therapist could help too.</li>
<li>Remember that your decision-making skills haven’t fully matured if you’re a teen.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 20" class="reference" id="_ref-20"><a href="#_note-20">[20]</a></sup> Choosing to use drugs is a decision that could haunt you for the rest of your life. Will your 50-year-old self thank you for deciding to try drugs?</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Be-Drug-Free-Step-9.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_d295038823" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d295038823')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Be-Drug-Free-Step-9.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 9" class="step_num">9</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_9"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Say no assertively.</b> Most likely there will come a time when you will be asked to do drugs. Be firm in your answer and do not hesitate. If you hesitate you leave the door open for peer pressure.

<ul>
<li>If someone who offers you drugs asks you why you do not want to do them you do not need to give any reasons. Just say that you don’t do drugs. If you provide reasons you leave the door open for further conversation, where the person can then try to persuade you to try the drugs.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 21" class="reference" id="_ref-21"><a href="#_note-21">[21]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>You may have people try to change your mind by saying things such as "But everyone's doing it" or "Just once won't hurt you." Remain firm. You can tell the person that in fact, drug use has gone down among young people, so clearly not everyone is doing it, and you won't be either.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 22" class="reference" id="_ref-22"><a href="#_note-22">[22]</a></sup> Or you can say "Nope, not even once. I don't need that in my life."</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-10.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-10.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Be-Drug-Free-Step-10.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-10.jpg" height="546" id="img_79f52f3dbb" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_79f52f3dbb')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Be-Drug-Free-Step-10.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-10.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 10" class="step_num">10</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_10"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stay engaged.</b> Keep your mind sharp and actively involved in the world around you. If you stay engaged and busy and active you will not have the time to do drugs. Boredom can lead to drug use, so by never being bored you will be less likely to use drugs.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 23" class="reference" id="_ref-23"><a href="#_note-23">[23]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Learn a new language. Pick up a hobby. Teach yourself a musical instrument. Volunteer in your community. You will enrich your life (and boost your resume) and help yourself stay away from drugs.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-11.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-11.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Be-Drug-Free-Step-11.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-11.jpg" height="546" id="img_28f460e9da" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_28f460e9da')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Be-Drug-Free-Step-11.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-11.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 11" class="step_num">11</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_11"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Figure out what makes you happy.</b> Depression and low self-esteem can lead to drug use. If you are <a href="/Deal-with-Depression" title="Deal with Depression">experiencing depression</a>, you should seek a counselor to help you work through it. In addition, pursuing things that make you happy and maintain your self-esteem will make you less likely to default to drug use.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 24" class="reference" id="_ref-24"><a href="#_note-24">[24]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Make a list of everything that makes you happy. Pick a few that are easily attainable, such as experiences like cooking an inexpensive meal, or going to the movies, and be sure to engage in those activities regularly.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>

</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>

<a class="anchor" name="Refraining_From_Using_Drugs_Again_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Refraining_From_Using_Drugs_Again">Refraining From Using Drugs Again</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-12.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-12.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Be-Drug-Free-Step-12.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-12.jpg" height="546" id="img_3adc1f486b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3adc1f486b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Be-Drug-Free-Step-12.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-12.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Understand why people use drugs.</b> People become addicted because they are self-medicating. Then they are held within the cycle of addiction because of the withdrawal symptoms from the drug.The way to become drug free is to first confront the physical addiction through going to a clinic where you can participate in a program to help with the withdrawal symptoms, which at times can be life-threatening, and then addressing the emotional issues that lead to the decision to use addicting drugs to mask the emotional pain.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 25" class="reference" id="_ref-25"><a href="#_note-25">[25]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>People who use drugs are <i>not</i> “bad” or “immoral” people.</li>
<li>People who use drugs often cannot simply “knock it off.” Drug addictions change your brain in ways that make it difficult -- but not impossible -- to quit.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-13.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-13.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Be-Drug-Free-Step-13.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-13.jpg" height="546" id="img_edfde4a9e9" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_edfde4a9e9')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Be-Drug-Free-Step-13.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-13.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Know your triggers.</b> If you have used drugs before, be cognizant of the triggers that are associated with your using drugs. This could include drug paraphernalia, a group of friends, a certain location, or even a certain song that you used to listen to when you did drugs.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 26" class="reference" id="_ref-26"><a href="#_note-26">[26]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If there are certain triggers that you know may cause a problem and lead to drug use, throw them away. Delete that song from your ipod or throw out those rolling papers; if your triggers are permanently gone you will be less likely to use drugs.</li>
<li>You may also need to not go to places you used to go when you used drugs. Staying away may be difficult, but it will help you kick your drug use.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-14.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-14.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Be-Drug-Free-Step-14.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-14.jpg" height="546" id="img_fa9daee70b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fa9daee70b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Be-Drug-Free-Step-14.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-14.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Join a community or family-based recovery support system.</b> Support is key not only to staying off of drugs, but to getting off them. If you are struggling to live a drug free life, a support group may be helpful.

<ul>
<li>To find one, talk to your doctor, counselor or other healthcare provider, check your phone book for a list of local support groups, consult with your religious or secular community groups, or speak with local or national groups who are devoted to helping people get past addictions<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 27" class="reference" id="_ref-27"><a href="#_note-27">[27]</a></sup>.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-15.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-15.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Be-Drug-Free-Step-15.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-15.jpg" height="546" id="img_3646948394" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3646948394')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Be-Drug-Free-Step-15.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-15.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try “urge surfing.</b>” Urge surfing is a mindfulness exercise that acknowledges your craving and helps you “ride it out” until it goes away. Imagine you are a surfer riding your craving like a wave until it breaks and becomes soft and small and easy to handle.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 28" class="reference" id="_ref-28"><a href="#_note-28">[28]</a></sup> Urge surfing is more effective than trying to ignore or repress a craving.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 29" class="reference" id="_ref-29"><a href="#_note-29">[29]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Remind yourself that this probably is not the first time you have experienced the urge to do drugs. Has that urge passed before? The answer is almost certainly yes. Remind yourself that it will pass this time too. The urge exists, but you do not have to act on it.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 30" class="reference" id="_ref-30"><a href="#_note-30">[30]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Notice the thoughts and sensations that you experience during the urge. For example, you might feel a strong feeling that you want to use your drug of choice. You might feel sweaty or itchy, or feel restless. Acknowledge these as existing. Remind yourself that they are just thoughts; they do not truly have power over you.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 31" class="reference" id="_ref-31"><a href="#_note-31">[31]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Focus on <a href="/Breathe-Deeply" title="Breathe Deeply">deep breathing</a> as you surf your urges. Breathe slowly and evenly, in and out. This will help keep your attention on the present moment rather than focusing on your craving.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-16.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-16.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Be-Drug-Free-Step-16.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-16.jpg" height="546" id="img_5c5e7d6486" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5c5e7d6486')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Be-Drug-Free-Step-16.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-16.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Tell yourself you’ll wait 10 minutes.</b> If you feel a very strong urge to use drugs, delay by telling yourself you will make yourself wait 10 minutes. Just 10, that’s all. You can do that. When that 10 minutes is up, if the urge is still strong, tell yourself you’ll wait another 10 minutes. Keep delaying until the urge passes. It will, given enough time.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 32" class="reference" id="_ref-32"><a href="#_note-32">[32]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Keeping_Your_Body_Healthy_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Keeping_Your_Body_Healthy">Keeping Your Body Healthy</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-17.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-17.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Be-Drug-Free-Step-17.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-17.jpg" height="546" id="img_d66f6786b0" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d66f6786b0')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Be-Drug-Free-Step-17.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-17.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Eat healthy.</b> The mind and body are intricately related because the mind consists of the complex workings of the brain, a biological organ and part of the body. This means that mental health and bodily health are closely related. Since poor mental health is associated with drug use, and mental and bodily health are related, keeping a healthy body is an important part of being drug free. One way to maintain a healthy body is to eat healthy foods.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 33" class="reference" id="_ref-33"><a href="#_note-33">[33]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Eat whole foods such as lean meats, nuts, fruits, and vegetables. Who knows, you might even develop a passion for cooking that builds your self-esteem and turns into a hobby that helps to keep you drug free. <sup aria-label="Link to Reference 34" class="reference" id="_ref-34"><a href="#_note-34">[34]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-18.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-18.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Be-Drug-Free-Step-18.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-18.jpg" height="546" id="img_60d7009059" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_60d7009059')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Be-Drug-Free-Step-18.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-18.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Exercise.</b> Working out can release endorphins that make you feel good in a much healthier way than the way that drugs make you feel good. Exercise helps to reduce stress and can even combat minor cases of depression; both stress and depression increase risk for drug use, so it is important to exercise regularly to help to keep drug free. <sup aria-label="Link to Reference 35" class="reference" id="_ref-35"><a href="#_note-35">[35]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px">
<a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Get-Rid-of-Acidity-Step-14.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Get-Rid-of-Acidity-Step-14.jpg"><img alt="Image titled Get Rid of Acidity Step 14" class="whcdn" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Get-Rid-of-Acidity-Step-14.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Get-Rid-of-Acidity-Step-14.jpg" height="546" id="img_0a5b9091bb" style="display:none" width="728"/><script>var img = document.getElementById('img_0a5b9091bb');
defer.add(img);
</script></a><noscript><img alt="Image titled Get Rid of Acidity Step 14" class="whcdn" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Get-Rid-of-Acidity-Step-14.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Get-Rid-of-Acidity-Step-14.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
</div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Avoid having too much caffeine.</b> Too much caffeine can make you jittery and anxious which can contribute to feelings of stress and make you more likely to turn to using (other) drugs to counteract the anxiety that the caffeine produced. <sup aria-label="Link to Reference 36" class="reference" id="_ref-36"><a href="#_note-36">[36]</a></sup><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 37" class="reference" id="_ref-37"><a href="#_note-37">[37]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-20.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-20.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Be-Drug-Free-Step-20.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-20.jpg" height="546" id="img_d9e6ec9e15" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d9e6ec9e15')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Be-Drug-Free-Step-20.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-20.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Get enough sleep.</b> A lack of sleep can contribute to poor mental health such as by causing feelings of fatigue, sadness, and anxiety, all of which may add to your likelihood of using drugs in order to avoid feeling bad.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 38" class="reference" id="_ref-38"><a href="#_note-38">[38]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-21.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-21.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Be-Drug-Free-Step-21.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-21.jpg" height="546" id="img_202fa3412e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_202fa3412e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Be-Drug-Free-Step-21.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-21.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Relax your body and mind.</b> Practice relaxation techniques to help stay mentally and physically healthy. Relaxation techniques reduce the impact of stress on your body by negating negative feelings and negative bodily sensations such as muscle tension.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 39" class="reference" id="_ref-39"><a href="#_note-39">[39]</a></sup> Stress is a common reason that people begin using drugs, so managing your stress will help you stay drug-free.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 40" class="reference" id="_ref-40"><a href="#_note-40">[40]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Try visualization. This technique involves forming peaceful and relaxing mental images. For example, picture a calm ocean and try to imagine it with all of your senses; think about how it would smell, how the wind and sun would feel against your skin. Fully immerse yourself in the experience.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 41" class="reference" id="_ref-41"><a href="#_note-41">[41]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Try a soothing exercise, such as yoga or tai chi.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-22.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-22.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 22" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Be-Drug-Free-Step-22.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-22.jpg" height="546" id="img_493b75a8ed" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_493b75a8ed')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 22" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Be-Drug-Free-Step-22.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-22.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try meditation.</b> Meditation can be an excellent way to manage stress and focus on breathing and body awareness. <a href="/Meditate" title="Meditate">Meditate</a> to calm yourself as you confront urges to use alcohol or drugs.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 42" class="reference" id="_ref-42"><a href="#_note-42">[42]</a></sup> People who meditate tend to have greater success rates of staying off drugs in the long run.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 43" class="reference" id="_ref-43"><a href="#_note-43">[43]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Find a comfortable and quiet spot to sit for 10-15 minutes.</li>
<li>Focus on your breath, inhaling deeply and steadily.</li>
<li>As thoughts pass through your mind, release them without judgment. Turn your attention back to your breath.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-23.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-23.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 23" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Be-Drug-Free-Step-23.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-23.jpg" height="546" id="img_fd66c9bb70" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fd66c9bb70')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 23" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Be-Drug-Free-Step-23.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-23.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try progressive muscle relaxation.</b> This technique helps you to figure out the difference between tense and relaxed muscles. It involves slowly tensing then relaxing each muscle group; this will help to delineate the difference between tense and relaxed and take your mind off what is stressing you out.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 44" class="reference" id="_ref-44"><a href="#_note-44">[44]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Begin with your toes. Clench them as hard as you can for 5 seconds, and then relax for 5 seconds. Notice the sensation of relaxation. Move up your body from your calves, thighs, buttocks, abs, chest, shoulders, arms, neck, and face.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 45" class="reference" id="_ref-45"><a href="#_note-45">[45]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Seeking_Treatment_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>4</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Seeking_Treatment">Seeking Treatment</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_4">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-24.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-24.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 24" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Be-Drug-Free-Step-24.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-24.jpg" height="546" id="img_25a91ef68c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_25a91ef68c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 24" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Be-Drug-Free-Step-24.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-24.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Seek counseling.</b> People who are recovering from an addiction need guidance and treatment. Counseling can offer you the support you need to remain drug free when giving up or recovering from an addiction.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 46" class="reference" id="_ref-46"><a href="#_note-46">[46]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Behavioral treatment, such as cognitive behavioral therapy, is very effective in helping people who use drugs manage their urges and stop their drug use.</li>
<li>Family therapy can also be helpful, particularly if your family dysfunction is contributing to your drug use.</li>
<li>Contingency management uses positive reinforcement, such as rewards, for staying off drugs.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-25.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-25.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 25" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Be-Drug-Free-Step-25.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-25.jpg" height="546" id="img_235471e8ad" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_235471e8ad')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 25" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Be-Drug-Free-Step-25.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-25.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Consider attending a detox facility.</b> There are benefits and drawbacks to inpatient or outpatient facilities. Inpatient facilities enable close monitoring, remove the potential for drug use, and the detox process is fairly accelerated. However, these can be quite expensive and may limit other activities, such as work. Outpatient treatments cost less and have less of an impact on the individual's life, but may not be as effective due to the potential for access to drugs due to being outside of the facility.This has the advantage of being less disruptive to the patient's life and less expensive. The best setting depends on a variety of factors, including the drug of abuse, the drug user's amount and length of history of abuse, the patient's age, and co-existing medical and/or psychiatric conditions among others. <sup aria-label="Link to Reference 47" class="reference" id="_ref-47"><a href="#_note-47">[47]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>To find a detox center, search here: <a class="external free" href="https://findtreatment.samhsa.gov/" rel="nofollow">https://findtreatment.samhsa.gov/</a>
</li>
<li>People with serious drug use problems, a long history of drug use, involvement in criminal activity, or trouble with social functioning due to drugs are often helped by residential treatment at a detox facility.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 48" class="reference" id="_ref-48"><a href="#_note-48">[48]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-26.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31841" href="#/Image:Be-Drug-Free-Step-26.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 26" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/20/Be-Drug-Free-Step-26.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-26.jpg" height="546" id="img_1aae6693b6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_1aae6693b6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Drug Free Step 26" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/20/Be-Drug-Free-Step-26.jpg/aid31841-v4-728px-Be-Drug-Free-Step-26.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Find a sponsor.</b> Many peer-based support groups assign sponsors to new members. The sponsor is a recovering addict who will help you through the steps of the recovery program. A good sponsor will<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 49" class="reference" id="_ref-49"><a href="#_note-49">[49]</a></sup>:

<ul>
<li>help you to grow, to become more productive, by your definition.</li>
<li>help you become more autonomous, more loving of yourself, more excited, less sensitive, more free to become the authority for your own living.</li>
<li>not be a crutch or be around you if you fail to make progress.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="123980" data-caid="124853" data-cqid="123997" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="922359" data-submitter_id="3855475" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="5" data-votes_up="25">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How do I not get mad if I find drugs that belong to my son? </div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://www.wikihow.com/images/avatarOut/2/28/3855475.jpg?20161020005607)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"><span class="qa_user_link" data-href="/User:Ashleaa">A</span></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Finding drugs in your son's room would be a big deal. If you do find anything, talk to him asap & seek help for him. Try not to flip out on him, he will need all the support he can get.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="243116" data-caid="243989" data-cqid="243133" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1293008" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="5" data-votes_up="24">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Why do people do drugs anyway?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">I chose drugs to numb myself of the pain I couldn't deal with. The most important word here is that I chose to do the drugs but didn't choose the addiction. I didn't want it to go that far, but it did. I didn't want to deal with feeling anything. When things get too complicated or difficult I turn to drugs. I hate that I turn to drugs, but it's something I've always done. I wish I had a mother to care about me to just ask me what's wrong and help me through it. I recommend researching why people choose drugs and the way an addict thinks so you understand more before you jump in. If you make him feel bad for what he's doing it will only make things worse for him.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="420407" data-caid="421280" data-cqid="420424" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2087271" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="5">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How can I keep myself from buying drugs?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">

<div class="qa_answerer_info">

</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Put your money into a savings account when you get it and resolve not to touch it for any reason. You could also try spending your spare money on things that are healthier for you, like a gym membership, some books, etc.</div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>Talk to those you trust about your temptation, they'll understand and help you avoid it.</li>
<li>If you have a drug problem talk to a school counsellor, or consider joining a group such as Alcoholics Anonymous, Alateen, or N.A.</li>
<li>Never take drugs. Medicine is considered a drug but never abuse your medication.</li>
<li>Be brave and don't be afraid to say <b>"NO"</b> when offered drugs or alcohol.</li>
<li>Educate yourself. Knowing what can happen is half the battle. D.A.R.E. and Above the Influence can help you understand the possible drugs out there and what they can do to your body.</li>
</ul>

<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>To be drug free, try to spend your time doing other things that make you feel good, like running, playing video games, or reading a good book. Also, try picking up a new hobby or teaching yourself something new to help distract you from urges and cravings. If you have friends or family members that do drugs, you should consider distancing yourself from them so they can't pressure you to do them too. Remember that you can always reach out to a counselor or trusted family member for help if you're having trouble giving up drugs on your own. <span id="summary_last_sentence">To learn how to keep your body healthy so you're less tempted to do drugs, scroll down!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>
